content.question: The case Plessy v. Ferguson (1896) upheld the standard of “separate but equal” in American law. Which of the following explains how this case relates to Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka (1954) ?

choices.label: Plessy established a precedent that was eventually overturned in the Brown case.
The decision in Plessy was used to support the ruling in Brown.
The “separate but equal” principle was established in Plessy and used in Brown.
The “separate but equal” principle was upheld in Brown but not in Plessy.

content.answer: Plessy established a precedent that was eventually overturned in the Brown case.
